intro: Hieracium lanceosum, commonly known as the lance-leaved hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, preferring full sun to partial shade. Its leaves are lance-shaped and hairy, while its yellow flowers bloom in clusters. Hieracium lanceosum is often found in temperate regions and is known for its ability to thrive in a variety of soil conditions.
